Interface GameEventListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
GuiController
public interface GameEventListener
Defines UI-side callbacks that respond to game state changes and bindings. Enables initialization, refresh, score/level bindings, visual effects, and game over handling.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Eashwar

  • Method Details

    • initGameView

      void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game view with the current board and active brick data.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the background matrix for the board
      brick - the active brick and preview/hold information

    • refreshGameBackground

      void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the rendered background from the updated board matrix.
      Parameters:
      board - the updated background matrix

    • setEventListener

      void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Registers the input event listener for handling user interactions.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - the input event listener to register

    • bindScore

      void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the score property to UI elements.
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - the score property

      Binds the lines cleared property to UI elements.

    • pulseLandedBlocks

      void pulseLandedBlocks(int[][] brickShape, int xPosition, int yPosition)
      Triggers a pulse effect for blocks after a hard drop.
      Parameters:
      brickShape - the landed brick matrix
      xPosition - the x-position of the brick
      yPosition - the y-position of the brick

    • gameOver

      void gameOver(boolean newHighScore)
      Handles game-over sequence and visuals.
      Parameters:
      newHighScore - whether the game ended with a new high score
